snippet: The law would not take effect unless four other states, at least one of which shares a border with Connecticut, passed similar regulations.
abstract: Connecticut becomes first state to pass bill that will require food manufacturers to label products that contain genetically modified ingredients; law will not take effect unless four other states, at least one of which shares a border with Connecticut, pass similar regulations.
lead_paragraph: The law would not take effect unless four other states, at least one of which shares a border with Connecticut, passed similar regulations.

headline.main: Connecticut Approves Labeling Genetically Modified Foods
